title: SEC.gov | JP Morgan Affiliates to Pay $151 Million to Resolve SEC Charges
JP Morgan to Pay $151 Million Over Major Disclosure Failures
CFTC Orders J.P. Morgan to Pay $200m for Supervision Errors
J.P. Morgan Fined $3M for Misreporting 77 Billion Shares - Yahoo Finance
reasoning: The Securities and Exchange Commission has charged J.P. Morgan Securities LLC and J.P. Morgan Investment Management Inc. for various failures, including misleading disclosures to investors and breach of fiduciary duty. The total penalty amounts to $151 million.
JP Morgan has agreed to pay $151 million to settle charges related to misleading disclosures and breaches of fiduciary duty, indicating serious compliance issues across multiple business lines.
The Commodity Futures Trading Commission has imposed a $200 million penalty on J.P. Morgan for supervision failures, highlighting systemic issues within the organization.
FINRA has imposed a $3 million fine on J.P. Morgan for reporting errors related to short interest, indicating ongoing regulatory scrutiny.
